clinical_study.brief_title: Multicentric Retrospective Observational Study of Thoracic Scanner Performance in COVID Screening
clinical_study.official_title: Multicentric Retrospective Observational Study of Thoracic Scanner Performance in COVID Screening. Comparison to Virological Testing and Multiparametric Gold Standard

brief_summary.textblock:
All patients included in this search will be on anonymized file: Symptomatic patients
      consulting for suspicion of COVID 19 with indication to a screening (RT-PCR, Scanner)
      according to the criteria of the Ministry of Health.

      To evaluate the diagnostic performance of chest CT in screening for COVID-related lung injury
      in patients with a clinical suspicion of COVID.

      CT scan results for COVID according to French thoracic imaging society will be dichotomized
      into evocative or compatible (considered positive) non-evocative (considered negative) The
      results will be compared to the gold standard corresponding to a multiparametric element: the
      discharge summary.

      Ct Scan performance will be recorded and analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic performance of chest CT in screening for pulmonary lesions in clinical suspicions of COVID.
primary_outcome.description: CT Report will dichotomized into evocative or non-evocative for COVID-related lung injury.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the diagnostic performance of chest CT and RT-PCR in COVID 19 at the initial consultation (screening).
secondary_outcome.description:
Initial virological RT-PCR results: positive or negative depending on the laboratories of the institutions.
Scanner results according to French Thoracic Imaging Society.

clinical_study.condition: The Gold Standard for Current SARS CoV2 Detection is RT-PCR

intervention.description: Retrospective analysis of the thoracic CT scan results compared to final discharge summary

study_pop.textblock: All patients suspected of COVID 19 consulting for diagnostic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All patients suspected of COVID 19 consulting for diagnostic

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Delay between RT-PCR and Thoracic Scan greater than 6 days.
